title: Trump Said to Demand Justice Dept. Pay Him $230 Million for Past Cases
summary: Senior department officials who were defense lawyers for the president and those in his orbit are now in jobs that typically must approve any such payout, underscoring potential ethical conflicts.

title: Trump Dismisses Another Inspector General, Fueling Oversight Concerns
summary: With the firing of the Export-Import Bank’s inspector general, the president has sidelined around two dozen of the watchdogs who seek out fraud and mismanagement in federal agencies.

title: Trump Officials Move Toward Deal With University of Virginia After Standoff
summary: The Trump administration is closing in on a deal with the University of Virginia, four months after government pressure forced the school’s previous president to resign.

title: A 200-Year-Old Precedent Holds the Key to Trump’s Troop Deployment
summary: The administration says the ruling, stemming from the seizure of an old mare, forbids judges from second-guessing his use of the National Guard.

title: In Trump’s Washington, Hate Is Not a Deal Breaker
summary: Paul Ingrassia’s nomination illustrated how much antisemitic and hateful rhetoric has been explained away or rewarded by Republicans in power.

summary: Architects were surprised by the scale and speed of the project, but the president is moving forward with his plans for a ballroom at the White House.

title: What to Know About Trump’s Plan for a Triumphal Arch in Washington
summary: President Trump has proposed construction of an arch in the style of the Arc de Triomphe in Washington in the lead-up to the nation’s 250th anniversary.

title: In a Reversal, Trump Will Not Meet With Putin in Coming Weeks
summary: The back-and-forth was the latest example of President Trump teasing a breakthrough, only to be pulled back by President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

title: Inside Luigi Mangione’s Missing Months
summary: From beers at a Bangkok bar to a climb up Mount Omine in Japan, The Times traced the pivotal months before Mr. Mangione was charged with killing UnitedHealthcare’s C.E.O.

title: With Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire, Some Pro-Palestinian Protesters Look Back at Their Movement, Ruefully
summary: Activists welcome the truce. But the backlash to their demonstrations, some said, offered sobering lessons about power and politics.

title: Vance Lands in Israel as U.S. Tries to Shore Up Gaza Cease-Fire Deal
summary: Vice President JD Vance appeared undeterred by recent flare-ups of violence in Gaza, and he declined to set a deadline for when Hamas must disarm.

title: A Nepali Town Mourns a Native Son Who Died a Hamas Captive
summary: The family of Bipin Joshi, a student, had campaigned internationally for his release and had held out hope until the end that after two years in Gaza, he would return alive.

title: Stolen Louvre Jewelry Worth Over $100 Million, Paris Prosecutor Says
summary: The eight pieces are unlikely to garner that price if they are split apart or melted, the prosecutor said Tuesday.

summary: Jewelry swiped from the museum played a prominent part in a private guide’s tours of Paris. Now what?

title: Stephanie Johnson, Burlesque Dancer With Stories to Tell, Dies at 81
summary: Her memories of her days as Tanqueray in the gritty New York of the 1960s and ’70s found a new audience in recent years and made her a social media star.

title: Antidepressant Side Effects Vary Widely by Drug, Study Finds

title: Alina Habba Told to Release Videos in Assault Case Against Democrat

title: U.S. Marshal and Immigrant Are Shot During L.A. Traffic Stop
